topic: 今[いま] 時[じ] 分[ふん/ぷん] です
explanations: To express time, the counter suffixes 時[じ](o'clock) and 分[ふん/ぶん](minutes) are placed after the numbers
分 is read ふん after 2,5,7 or 9 and ぷん after 1,3,4,6,8 or 10
1,6,8 and 10 are read as いっ,ろっ,はっ,じゅっ(or じっ) before ぷん
To ask the time, なん is placed in front of じ or ぷん
examples: 1) 今[いま] 何[なん]時[じ]ですか。
1) What time is it now?

topic: Verb ます/ Verb ません/ Verb ました/ Verb ませんでした
explanations: Verb ます and its other forms works as predicates and shows respect to the listener
ます form is used when affirming something that is either habitual or in the present/future
ません form is used when denying something that is either habitual or in the present/future
ました form is used when affirming something that is in the past
ませんでした form is used when affirming something that is in the past
examples: 1) 毎[まい]朝[あさ] 6時[じ] 起[お]きます。
1) I wake up at 6 every morning
2) 明日[あひた] 6時[じ] 起[お]きます。
2) I'm going to get up at 6 tomorrow
3) 今朝[けさ] 6時[じ] 起[お]きました。
3) I woke up at 6 this morning

explanations: The particle に is appended to a time noun to indicate the time of occurrence of an action
[Note] に should only be used for time nouns that include numbers such as 時[じ] and 分[ふん/ぶん]
[Note] に can be optionally used for the following nouns: ~ようび, あさ, ひる, ばん, よる
examples: 1) 6時[じ]半[はん]に 起[お]きます。
1) I wake up at 6:30
2) 7月[がつ]2日[か]に 日[に]本[ほん]へ 来[き]ました。
2) I came to Japan on the 2nd of July
3) 日曜日[にちようび]に 奈良[なら]へ いきます。
3) I am going to Nara on Sunday

topic: Noun1 から Noun2 まで
explanations: から indicates a starting time or place, and まで indicates the finishing time or place
から and まで can be used separately and are not always used together
To indicate the starting or finishing time/date of a noun introduced as a topic, デスan be added after ~から or ~まで
examples: 1) 9時[じ]から 5時[じ]まで 勉[べん]強[きょう]します。
1) I study from 9 to 5
2) 大[おお]阪[さか]から 東[とう]京[きょう]まで 9時[じ]間[かん] かかります。
2) It takes 3 hours from Osaka to Tokyo
3) 9時[じ]から 働[はたら]きます。
3) I start work at 9
4) 銀行[ぎんこう]は 9時[じ]から 3時[じ]までです。
4) The bank is open from 9 to 3
5) 昼休[ひるやす]みは 12時[じ]からです。
5) Lunchtime starts at 12

explanations: The particle と connects two nouns in coordinate relation
examples: 1) 銀行[ぎんこう]は 休[やす]みは 土[ど]曜日[ようび]と 日[にち]曜日[ようび]です。
1) The bank is closed on Saturdays and Sundays

explanations: The particle ね is attached to the end of a sentence and is used to elicit agreement from the listener
Or to check that the listener has understood, or emphasize something to the listener
examples: 1) 毎[まい]日[にち] 10時[じ]まで 勉[べん]強[きょう]します。
1) I study till 10 every day
1) ... 大[たい]変[へん]ですね。
1) ... That's tough, isn't it
2) 山田[やまだ]さんの 電[でん]話[わ]番[ばん]号[ごう]は 871の 6813 です。
2) Mr Yamada's telephone number is 871-6813
